hypotheses.title: The Rare Earth
hypotheses.headline: There's no one else because we're super rare.
hypotheses.text:
The emergence of complex life such as it is on Earth required an improbable combination of astrophysical and geological events and circumstances. Thus, complex extraterrestrial life is higly improbable.
Basically, we were super luckiy that the Earth is at the right location in the right kind of galaxy, orbiting at the right distance of the right kind of sun with a stable orbit, and so on and so forth...
So yeah, we are one of a kind.

links.page: Rare Earth hypothesis - Planetary Science, inc.

hypotheses.title: The Early Birds
hypotheses.headline: There's no one else because we're the first.
hypotheses.text:
Earth might have had an an headstrat. The last star will burn out 100 trillion years from now and 92% of the planets are yet to be born. That's plenty of time for literally anything to happen, so alien life is quite highly probable.
Maybe we will become one of the first super-intelligent civilizations and witness other species come to life and develop.

links.page: Most Earth-Like Worlds Yet to be Born - Nasa

hypotheses.title: We're Doomed!
hypotheses.headline: There's no one else and soon not even us. The Great Filter is ahead of us.
hypotheses.text:
If we're not rare nor early, then we are not passed the Great Filter. This means that species often reach the point we already reached, but go extinct soon after. And there is no reason to think we will avoid the rule.
So we're doomed. We will be wiped out by regularly-occurring cataclysmic natural event. Other  possibility, and an ironic one, we will destroy ourselves with some human-made doomsday machine that was created to solve all our problems.

links.page: Why Alien Life Would be Our Doom - Kurzgesagt

hypotheses.title: A Big Universe
hypotheses.headline: There might be others civilization, but the Universe is really big, light-speed is slow, we are super slow.
hypotheses.text: We would have to travel 46.5 billion light-years to reach the edge of the observable Universe? The Milky Way is 'only' 100,000 light-years wide and we've only scanned 40% of it, let alone truly explored. Alien life could simply be too far away for our current technology to reach, and maybe too far away period. The Universe is truly a big thing full of emptiness.

hypotheses.title: Going Unnoticed
hypotheses.headline: Our means of communication are primitive and we are undetectable. Or it's the other way around, same result.
hypotheses.text:
The technology we use to communicate might actually be very primitive and no advanced civilizations use what we use. Maybe other civilizations are just too alien, and there is no way to exchange information with them.
Like Michio Kaku puts it: ‘Would the ants be able to understand what a ten-lane super-highway is? Would the ants be able to understand the technology and the intentions of the beings building the highway next to them?’.

links.page: Michio Kaku, The Impossible Science - The Daily Grail

hypotheses.title: The Zoo
hypotheses.headline: Other civilizations are aware of us and observing us develop.
hypotheses.text: Alien life intentionally avoids communication with Earth. And that is because it is the only way to obserse us develop, just like you observe animals at a zoo. We can also easily extend this hypothesis to something a bit more uncanny : instead of a 'protected national park', we could be in a laboratory and are part of an experiment. There is no way for us to know if this is altruistic or sadic.

hypotheses.title: The Dark Forest
hypotheses.headline: Predator civilizations are out there and most intelligent species keep it quiet so they stay hidden and safe.
hypotheses.text:
If this is true, it means that we are extremly naive and stupid. By actively searching for alien life, we broadcast our location to anybody listening. If we look back in our past history, things didn't go well for native Americans whey Europeans found them.
And scarier idea: what if instead of multiple low-level predators, there were one 'superpredator' civilization that exterminates any intelligent civilization once they get past a certain level. That would suck.

hypotheses.title: Outside is Boring
hypotheses.headline: Physical colonization is a backward concept for advanced species.
hypotheses.text: A super advanced civilization might have created a perfect environment and have zero interest in leaving their happy utopia to explore the cold, empty, undeveloped universe. They have uploaded their brains into a virtual reality where they live an eternal perfect life, and we will never find them.
